content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's the function `extract_julia_code` in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = findall(string(r"\n\n``` julia\n.*?\n```\n")), md)
    extracted_codes = join(map(str, collect(code_blocks)))) .#, '\n')
    return extracted_codes
end
```

This function takes a Markdown document as input and uses regular expressions to find the Julia code blocks. It then joins these code blocks together with a newline and returns the resulting string.

To use this function, you can call it with your Markdown document:

```julia
md = readstring("path/to/your/markdown.md"))
extracted_code = extract_julia_code(md)
println(extracted_code)
```

Replace `"path/to/your/markdown.md"` with the actual path to your Markdown document.
